question:
In order to strengthen the security of Aadhaar data, the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) introduced the concept of “Virtual ID”. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The virtual ID is a random 12-digit number
  2. It is temporary and revocable after specified time period
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect</u> because the “Virtual ID” is a random 16-digit number. <u>Second statement is correct</u>. The VID is revocable and can be replaced by a new one by Aadhaar number holder after the specified period of time. The Aadhaar-issuing body will start accepting the 'Virtual ID' from March 1, 2018. The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI), which issues the 12-digit Unique Identity Number as well as Aadhaar card, has taken this step to strengthen the security features of Aadhaar system through \"Virtual ID\".
